title: WHAT THE HELL!   RESET PASSWORD THROUGH AN EMAIL LINK AND IT WIPED MY ACCOUNT OF ALL DATA!
content: bold texti had to reinstall windows and had trouble remembering my password and had no idea that resetting the password would refresh or wipe clean all my saved tabs and passwords. This is aster-nine to think you browser gave no warning that this would happen.. I need my links, my tabs, password. No I had no other sync's, don't think I ever set a key. This is straight up stupid. I need to recover my account!!bold text
creator: juneannmystic

title: Does firefox keep more than 0 record of historic sessions?
content:
Long story short: windows update sneaked a restart under my nose caused me to lose all my previous session.

I'm attempting to recover the previous session.

I have backed up the unmodified session profile folder. But this profile folder was modified by the restart process obviously, as windows gave firefox "normal shutdown" command. How do I know that? The next time I opened it up, it's "brand new" without the "restore session" interface.

So my idea is to figure out if firefox keeps a track record of previous sessions EVEN IF THE SHUTDOWN WAS PROPER.

If it does, well I'll have to figure out a way to "trick" firefox to restore it. If it doesn't, well I'll have to manually restore it by sifting through the history.

I repeat, the key here is for me to find out whether or not firefox always keep a record of previous session somewhere.

So my question is, does it? Or does it purge all the previous session clean as long as the shutdown was deemed "correct"?
creator: cruelintention869

title: Problem         with veiwing Amazon books pages.
content:
I have a problem when I go to Amazon to look at a book. Sometimes, a veil comes over the page, and I can't click on anything. And after this starts, I can go back to a book that worked fine, and now it gets veiled up. If I get to other Amazon pages, this doesn't happen. Restarting the computer, at times, doesn't help.

Current Firefox updated, Windows 10 Up to date. Current Norton 360. Desktop Computer.

Any Ideas?
creator: larryp1

title: Sogning into an account on Firefox for Android is no longer possible
content: When I try to sign into my account on mobile (the app itself, not the site since clearly on the website I'm signed in) I get to a white screen that shows a bunch of details of my account status. I am not allowed to progress past this screen. Any way I leave that screen, closing the app, using back, praying the 'x' in they lower left corner, reverts my login. So sync is not allowed on FF mobile anymore? I wish they wouldn't still list it as an option in the app if it's depreciated and no longer supported. If this is a bug, well you got me since FF also doesn't allow bug reporting.
creator: jaredstander

title: page loads to small ICON above tol bar but won't open to full sixe page

title: Firefox Font Issues DIsplay
content:
Hi Guys,

For a couple of weeks now, and since the last update (102.0.1 64-bit), my Firefox displays odd characters in some pages and in all emails.

This issue doesn't happen in safari or Chrome.

I've cleared all cookies, and browsing data multiple times and re-installed Firefox and the issue comes back every time.

See attached a couple of samples
creator: skyjoker

title: Print preview never loads
content: Hey, I just installed windows + firefox on a new computer recently. The first time I tried to print a pdf from this computer via firefox (as windows does not allow pdf printing by default) and the print preview pops up with the loading symbol and just... never loads. Ever. I tried to switch to the default system dialogue via about:config and print.prefer_system_dialogue and setting it to true, but when I did that firefox just crashed every time I tried to print. I'd appreciate any help, as everything online in regards to this issue doesn't seem to help me at all.
creator: coolestclown
